abstract: John W. Rowe of Exelon, the electric utility, says he learned early in his career that it’s always important to take action — “to always be looking for something to do that moves the ball.”
snippet: John W. Rowe of Exelon, the electric utility, says he learned early in his career that it’s always important to take action — “to always be looking for something to do that moves the ball.”
lead_paragraph: This interview with  John W. Rowe, chairman and C.E.O. of the Exelon Corporation, the electric utility, was conducted and condensed by  Adam Bryant.

headline.main: A Sitting Duck Can’t Catch a Moving Turkey
headline.print_headline: A Sitting Duck Can Never Catch a Moving Turkey
